alert.note: Alert for Adair; Grundy; Mercer; Putnam; Schuyler; Sullivan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 1:04PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Missouri, north central Missouri, and northeast Missouri, including the following areas, in central Missouri, Cooper, Howard, and Saline. In north central Missouri, Carroll, Chariton, Grundy, Linn MO, Livingston, Macon, Mercer, Putnam, Randolph, and Sullivan. In northeast Missouri, Adair and Schuyler. * WHEN...From 10 PM CDT this evening through 10 AM Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing locally heavy rainfall are likely within the watch area tonight into Wednesday morning. Rain amounts of 2 to 4 inches with localized areas up to 6 inches are possible within the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Grundy; Mercer; Putnam; Schuyler; Sullivan
